articles.author: Shadia Nasralla, Ron Bousso
articles.description: BP CEO Bernard Looney has stepped down after less than four years in office following several allegations of personal relationships with colleagues, the company said in a statement on Tuesday.
articles.title: BP CEO Looney to resign after personal relationships with colleagues

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: Talks between the Detroit Three automakers and United Auto Workers union are nearing a Thursday night deadline to reach a deal on a new contract before a potential walkout by 146,000 U.S. autoworkers.
articles.title: US auto labor talks intensify near strike deadline

articles.author: Noel Randewich, Ankika Biswas
articles.description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq fell on Tuesday as a jump in oil prices deepened worries about persistent price pressures ahead of crucial inflation readings this week, while Oracle slumped after its downbeat forecast and results.
articles.title: S&P 500 dips as oil prices fan inflation fear, Oracle slumps on weak forecast

articles.author: Stephen Nellis
articles.description: Apple (AAPL.O) on Tuesday said that three of its Apple Watch models will come in what it calls carbon-neutral versions sporting a new green logo on their boxes, and the biggest change is that more of the transportation will be by boat instead of planes.
articles.title: Apple has a plan for climate-friendlier watches: cut plane travel

articles.author: Rajesh Singh, Abhijith Ganapavaram, Valerie Insinna
articles.description: Aerospace suppliers and airlines around the world warned of rising costs and a squeeze on plane capacity after U.S. engine maker RTX (RTX.N) disclosed that a rare manufacturing flaw could ground hundreds of Airbus (AIR.PA) jets in coming years.
articles.title: RTX jet engine problem ripples across global aerospace industry

articles.author: Katherine Masters
articles.description: Nike investors voted against two shareholder-led proposals during the sportswear giant’s annual meeting on Tuesday, according to a preliminary tally by the company.
articles.title: Nike investors reject pay equity, human rights proposals

articles.author: Blake Brittain, Katie Paul
articles.description: A group of writers including Pulitzer Prize winner Michael Chabon sued Meta Platforms (META.O) in San Francisco federal court on Tuesday, accusing the tech giant of misusing their works to train its Llama artificial-intelligence software.
articles.title: Pulitzer winner Chabon, other authors sue Meta over AI program

articles.author: Ayman Werfali
articles.description: About a quarter of Libya's eastern city of Derna was wiped out after dams burst in a storm, the administration in the area said on Tuesday, and the Red Cross said 10,000 people were feared to be missing across the country in floods.
articles.title: Libya floods wipe out quarter of city, 10,000 feared missing

articles.author: Diane Bartz
articles.description: The United States argued on Tuesday that Google (GOOGL.O) did not play by the rules in its efforts to keep its dominance in online search, paying billions of dollars to ensure that smaller rivals never got traction.
articles.title: US lays out how Google dominated search in much-anticipated antitrust trial

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A federal grand jury has indicted five former Memphis police officers in the killing of Tyre Nichols, a Black man who died after being beaten by police in January, according to a court document filed on Tuesday.
articles.title: Five former Memphis police officers indicted in Tyre Nichols killing
